org.apache.hawq.pxf.plugins.hdfs.utilities

Class RecordkeyAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hawq.pxf.plugins.hdfs.utilities.RecordkeyAdapter

  • public class RecordkeyAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
    Adapter used for adding a recordkey field to the records output List<OneField>.

    • Method Detail

      • appendRecordkeyField

        public int appendRecordkeyField(java.util.List<OneField> recFields,
                                InputData input,
                                OneRow onerow)
                         throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Adds the recordkey to the end of the passed in recFields list.

        This method also verifies cases in which record keys are not supported by the underlying source type, and therefore "illegally" requested.

        Parameters:
        recFields - existing list of record (non-key) fields and their values.
        input - all input parameters coming from the client request
        onerow - a row object which is used here in order to find out if the given type supports recordkeys or not.
        Returns:
        0 if record key not needed, or 1 if record key was appended
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - when the given record type does not support recordkeys

      • convertKeyValue

        public org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable convertKeyValue(java.lang.Object key)
        Converts given key object to its matching Writable. Supported types: Integer, Byte, Boolean, Double, Float, Long, String. The type is only checked once based on the key, all consequent calls must be of the same type.
        Parameters:
        key - object to convert
        Returns:
        Writable object matching given key
